frame.name: Reading_perception
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Reader</fen> attends to a <fen>Text</fen> to process its information. Sometimes a particular kind of <fen>Sought_phenomenon</fen> is sought in the <fen>Text</fen>. <ex></ex> The metaphor which allows motion verbs plus "through" to express reading (e.g. "went through the text", "slogging through the phonebook", "sped through the dialogue passages") is considered to be productive, and thus should be annotated in the Motion frames. The metaphor applies most productively to motion verbs that do not specify motor program and either specify no manner information at all (e.g. "go") or only specify the manner of motion in terms of difficulty and/or speed ("slog", "speed"), although other verbs with specific information ("saunter", "swim") may occur in more colorful usage.
<ex><fex name="Reader">I</fex> <t>read</t> <fex name="Text">A Tale of Two Cities</fex> <fex name="Time">last night</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Reader
FE.definition: <def-root>The one who examines a Text to understand it.</def-root>

FE.name: Sought_phenomenon
FE.definition: <def-root>A particular characteristic or thing that the Reader intends to process. <t>Read</t> Chapter 7 <fex name="Sought_phenomenon">only for the major concepts.</fex>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An act that allows the <fen>Reader</fen> to read in the specified manner. <ex>I <t>skimmed</t> the book <fex name="Mns">by reading just the section headings and the first sentences after</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> is the reason for which the <fen>Reader</fen> reads the <fen>Text</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>When the reading event takes place. <ex>Charlie often <t>reads</t> the newspaper <fex name="Time">at night</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>Where the reading event takes place. <ex>Surprisingly, few of the students <t>read</t> much at all <fex name="Place">in the designated reading rooms</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.</def-root>

FE.name: Context
FE.definition: <def-root>The context wherein the <fen>Reader</fen> reads a particular <fen>Text</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: read.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: look at and comprehend the meaning of (written or printed matter) by interpreting the characters or symbols of which it is composed.

lexUnit.name: pore.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be absorbed in the reading or study of.

lexUnit.name: scan.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: look at quickly in order to identify relevant features or information.

lexUnit.name: skim.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: read (something) quickly, noting only the important points.

lexUnit.name: peruse.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to read casually; coexists with older meaning "examine carefully".
